Today, we're going to be talking about how to approach a patient with a facial rash.
So, in summary, acne and rosacea are both chronic inflammatory diseases that are very common...
...rosacea presents more with papules and pustules without comedones.
Rosacea also tends to affect the central face, the flush areas of the skin...
...while acne can be much more widespread.
...and common triggers include things like sun, heat, strong emotions, alcohol, caffeine...
